basic.description:
An in-depth coverage of principles of health screening, exercise testing and exercise prescription for individuals with cardiovascular, metabolic and pulmonary diseases. An emphasis is placed on understanding disease pathophysiology and how this interacts with the acute response to exercise and the adaptation to training.
NOTE    This course will normally be offered in academic years starting with an even number (e.g., 2012-2013). Students in a KINE Specialization Plan will have priority over students in a PHED Specialization Plan.
RECOMMENDATION    KNPE 225/3.0 or KINE 225/3.0.
basic.subject: KNPE
basic.title: Clinical Exercise Physiology

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Recommendation    KNPE225 or KINE225.
Prerequisites    Level 3 or above in a PHED or KINE Specialization Plan and KNPE125, KNPE227 and KNPE255
